summary.Title: Operation Supervisor, Project Greensand, Contract
summary.Presentation: Do you want to be a part of an exciting project in an industry leading company in growth? Are you passionate about ensuring that everything is going according to plan in a safe and detailed manner

WorkPlace.Name: Semco Maritime
WorkPlace.OrganizationDescription: Dedicated to the energy sector, Semco Maritime is an international contracting and engineering company. For more than 30 years we have been facilitating design, fabrication, service and maintenance of our customers’ assets, providing comprehensive project management across all phases of energy projects. Semco Maritime is an international company with branches in Denmark, Norway, UK, UAE, Singapore, Vietnam, Central America and USA.

HiringOrg.Name: Semco Maritime
HiringOrg.OrganizationDescription: Dedicated to the energy sector, Semco Maritime is an international contracting and engineering company. For more than 30 years we have been facilitating design, fabrication, service and maintenance of our customers’ assets, providing comprehensive project management across all phases of energy projects. Semco Maritime is an international company with branches in Denmark, Norway, UK, UAE, Singapore, Vietnam, Central America and USA.

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Do you want to be a part of an exciting project in an industry leading company in growth? Are you passionate about ensuring that everything is going according to plan in a safe and detailed manner?
Then you have found your next opportunity!

Your position
As our Operation Supervisor you will join a highly skilled team and use the combined knowledge, expertise, and experience to deliver optimal solutions for Semco and the partners behind Project Greensand. Semco is responsible for delivering engineering, fabrication, installations and operations of CO2 tanks and pumps on the supply vessel and the drilling rig.
Read more about the project here https://www.projectgreensand.com/en

The position is a contract consultancy assignment with an expected end date by the end of the first quarter of 2023.

Your tasks & responsibilities 
You will play an important role in Semco Maritime’s part of Project Greensand by participating in the design of the facilities, fabrication, installations on the supply vessel and the drilling rig, as well as operations of the plant in the North Sea.

Your tasks will include, but are not limited to:
  • Describing tasks, operation procedures and training of personnel in handling CO2
  • Being the supervisor for and participating in the installations of the modifications on the supply vessel and the drilling rig and managing the team offshore on the supply vessel
  • Hiring personnel for the 3 months of operations on the supply vessel and drilling rig
  • Taking part in the offshore operations on the supply vessel
  • Daily reporting in Danish and English
Your profile & qualifications 
As a person you are responsible and reliable. You are a fast learner, and you have the ability to quickly understand new tasks and figure out how to complete them. You know the importance of HSE and have a great understanding of how to put it into practice.

To succeed in this position, we expect that you have the following qualifications:
  • Education in Marine Engineering or similar relevant education or background
  • Knowledge of and experience with working with CO2 or similar
  • Ability to work offshore
  • Experience with working on supply vessels or similar offshore operations
Welcome to Semco Maritime 
We offer you an interesting and challenging job in an international organization, where we strive to provide innovative and sustainable solutions globally. You will get the unique opportunity to work in an environment characterized by dedication, passion and ambition. 

Your place of work will be our location in Esbjerg by the seafront until the offshore rotations start. Traveling is to be expected as the supply vessel will be operationalized from Antwerp in Belgium.
 
We conduct our interviews on an ongoing basis, so if you are interested, you must submit your application as soon as possible via the link on the page. 
If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Christian Kirkegaard Christensen at +45 30 16 66 02.
 
We look forward to hearing from you!
